function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Limited scope of literature search due to use of only one database (Scopus).","Impact":"May miss relevant literature on the topic that is not included in the selected database, leading to incomplete analysis.","Mitigation":"Expand the search to include other relevant databases and sources of literature to ensure a comprehensive review.","Technologies":"Database search tools, literature review software","People":"Academics, researchers, practitioners, policymakers","Owner":"Research team, reviewers"},{"Description":"Exclusion of papers published after 2020 may result in missing recent developments and insights related to supply chain management strategies during and after the COVID-19 outbreak.","Impact":"Lack of up-to-date information on the evolving challenges and strategies in supply chain management, leading to outdated conclusions.","Mitigation":"Include recent literature and updates from 2021 and beyond to capture the latest trends and insights in supply chain management.","Technologies":"Publication tracking tools, literature alert services","People":"Academics, researchers, practitioners, policymakers","Owner":"Research team, reviewers"},{"Description":"Assumption about the impact of population vaccination on supply chain and logistics management strategies without concrete evidence.","Impact":"Risk of drawing premature or inaccurate conclusions about the impact of vaccination on supply chain strategies, leading to misleading insights.","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to gather empirical evidence on the influence of population vaccination on supply chain management before making conclusive hypotheses.","Technologies":"Data analysis tools, statistical software","People":"Academics, researchers, practitioners, policymakers","Owner":"Research team, analysts"}]}
